Uses of Class
edu.nyu.cs.cs101.consumers.Ball

    • Uses of Ball in edu.nyu.cs.cs101.consumers

      Subclasses of Ball in edu.nyu.cs.cs101.consumers 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ConsumingBall
      A ConsumingBall is a Ball that is always accelerating in the direction of the closest ball.
      class  EvadingBall
      An EvadignBall is a Ball that is always trying to move in the direction away from the nearest ball to it.
      class  ExpandableBall
      An ExpandableBall is a ball that implements the Expandable interface.
      class  IntelligentBall
      An intelligent ball is a Ball that: Tries to accelerate towards smaller balls that are near it (to consume them) Tries to accelerate away from larger balls that are near it (to evade them) TODO: All Intelligent balls should be blue by default TODO: Write this entire class.
      Methods in edu.nyu.cs.cs101.consumers with parameters of type Ball 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean Ball.equals(Ball b)
      Checks if two objects ('this' object and Ball b) are equivalent (have the same data).
      static boolean Ball.isCollision(Ball ball1, Ball ball2)
      Checks if a collision occurred between two Ball objects.
      Constructors in edu.nyu.cs.cs101.consumers with parameters of type Ball 
      Constructor and Description
      Ball(Ball b)
      Copy constructor - creates a new copy of Ball b.
